meanings.definition: A large, vertical pole on a ship that supports the sails.
meanings.sent1: The royalmast stood tall on the ship, holding up the sails.
meanings.sent2: The sailors climbed up the royalmast to adjust the sails.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the royalmast, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The royalmast reached towards the sky like a giant tree on the sea.
meanings.sent5: In the storm, the creaking of the royalmast echoed across the ocean.

meanings.definition: The highest mast on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The royalmast soared above all other masts, guiding the ship.
meanings.sent2: Sailors looked up at the royalmast, marveling at its height.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey climbed to the top of the royalmast and waved at the crew.
meanings.sent4: The royalmast stood proudly like a king overlooking his kingdom.
meanings.sent5: At sunset, the silhouette of the royalmast was a majestic sight against the sky.

meanings.definition: A mast that is used for hoisting the royal sails.
meanings.sent1: The royalmast displayed the grandeur of the royal sails as they unfurled.
meanings.sent2: The crew worked together to raise the royal sails on the royalmast.
meanings.sent3: The parrot perched on the royalmast, feeling like a member of the royal fleet.
meanings.sent4: The royalmast carried the pride of the kingdom's colors high above the waves.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gleamed on the royal sails hoisted on the royalmast, a regal sight.
